tit.e: Engi no chi (Reign of Emperor Daigo)
Engi no chi (Reign of Emperor Daigo)
tit.cmt: タイトルなので説明訳は削除しました。大文字に訂正しました。

sen.j: 延喜の治（えんぎのち）は、平安時代中期（10世紀前期）の醍醐天皇の治世を理想視した呼称。
sen.e: Engi no chi is an idealized name of the reign of Emperor Daigo in the mid-Heian Period (in the first half of the 10 the century).
Engi no chi is an idealized name of the reign of Emperor Daigo during the mid-Heian Period (during the first half of the 10 the century).
Engi no chi is an idealized name of the reign of Emperor Daigo during the mid-Heian period (during the first half of the 10th century).
sen.cmt: period小文字にしました。10thに訂正しました。

sen.j: 延喜は醍醐天皇の治世の元号である。
sen.e: Engi is the era name of the reign of Emperor Daigo.
Engi is the era name of the reign of Emperor Daigo.

sen.j: 醍醐天皇は摂関を置かず、また延喜格式が編纂されるなど、後世の人々から天皇親政による理想の政治が行われた治世と評価され、同じく10世紀中期に天皇親政が行われたとする村上天皇の治世（天暦の治）と併せて延喜・天暦の治と呼ばれた。
sen.e: As Emperor Daigo had no Sekkan (regents and advisers) and compiled "Engi no kyakushiki" (regulations and laws of the Engi era), his reign was considered by succeeding generations as the reign when an ideal politics was carried out by direct rule by the emperor and his reign was called as Engi, Tenryaku no chi (reign of Emperor Daigo and Murakami) together with the reign of Emperor Murakami (Tenryaku no chi (glorious Tenryaku rule) who also carried out the direct rule in the middle of the 10th century.

sen.cmt: Emperor大文字にしました。Engi and Tenryakuと訂正しました。数字に訂正しました。

sen.j: しかし、実際に延喜期の政務をリードしたのは太政官筆頭の左大臣藤原時平であった。
sen.e: However, the person who actually played an leading role in attending to government affairs in the Engi period was FUJIWARA no Tokihira, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), Daijokan hitto (head council of state).

sen.j: 時平は若くして亡くなり、天皇との外戚関係が無かったために摂関の地位に付かなかったものの、妹の藤原穏子を醍醐天皇の中宮とした。
sen.e: Tokihira died young and could not take up the position of Sekkan as he had no maternal relative to the emperor but he made his younger sister, FUJIWARA no Onshi a chugu (the second consort of an emperor) of Emperor Daigo.

sen.j: 醍醐には大勢の皇子がいたが皇太子になったのは、穏子所生の子のみであり後世の摂関政治の基礎が実はこの時期に形成されたことが分かる。
sen.e: Daigo had many princes but one who became a crown prince was only a child of Onshi and it turned out that the foundation of later Sekkan government was in fact made in this time.

sen.j: 時平は、醍醐天皇の前代宇多天皇の政治方針を継承した。
sen.e: Tokihira followed the political policy of Emperor Uda, the former emperor of Emperor Daigo.

sen.j: 宇多天皇の政治（寛平の治と呼ばれる）は、権門（有力貴族・寺社）を抑制し、小農民を保護するという律令制への回帰を強く志向していたが、時平もこの方針を受け継ぎ、例えば時平執政期の902年（延喜2年）には班田を励行する法令が発布されている。
sen.e: The politics by Emperor Uda (called Kanpyo no chi (Glorious rule in Kanpyo era)) strongly aspired to return to the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) which controlled influential families (dominant nobilities, temples and shrines) and protected peasant folks, and Tokihira also followed this policy, for example, by promulgating a law to enforce handen (the allotted farmland) in 902 during his administration.

sen.j: 同様に、この時期に行われた延喜格式の編纂も律令制回帰を目的としたものであった。
sen.e: In a similar way, the compiling of "Engi no kyakushiki"conducted in this period was also intended to return to the Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: ただ、現実には百姓層の階層分化が著しく進んでおり律令制的な人別支配はもはや不可能な段階に至っていたため、延喜の治は必ずしも成功したとは言えなかった。
sen.e: However, in reality, Engi no chi was not necessarily successful as the rank differentiation of a farmer class was significantly accelerated so the rule over people based on the Ritsuryo system had reached to the stage no longer impossible.

sen.j: 結果的に延喜の治は律令制復活の最後の試みとなり、次代の朱雀天皇および藤原忠平の治世から、律令制支配は完全に放棄されることとなり、新たな支配体制王朝国家体制の構築・充実が進展していったのである。
sen.e: As the result, Engi no chi was the last trial to bring back the Ritsuryo system, and the ruling system based on the Ritsuryo system was completely abandoned in the reign of the next emperor, Emperor Suzaku, and FUJIWARA no Tadahira and the establishment and reinforcement of a new system, i.e. the dynasty, state was started to be developed.

sen.cmt: the dynastyを the Imperial Court に訂正しました。

sen.j: なお、寛平の治は菅原道真の主導による王朝国家体制への転換準備期であり、延喜の治は道真の着想を引き継いだ時平による王朝国家体制への移行を意図したものであったが、時平により道真の政治の記録が抹殺されたため詳細が不明となっていたにすぎないとする平田耿二等の説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory by Koji HIRATA and others that Kanpyo no chi was a transition and preparation period for the dynasty state system led by SUGAWARA no Michizane and Engi no chi was intended to transit to the dynasty state system by Tokihira who took over the idea of Michizane but details had only been unknown because the political records of Michizane were eliminated by Tokihira.

sen.cmt: the dynasty state system を the national system ruled by imperial families に訂正しました。

sen.j: この説によると、延喜の班田励行は租税の額の確定を目的としたものであり、来るべき土地への課税を前提とした制度改革であったこととなる。
sen.e: According this theory, the enforcement of handen was intended to determine the land tax amount and it was a system reform focused on the coming taxation on land.
